intro: Asperula cynanchica var. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered woodruff, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and has small, opposite leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with five petals and a prominent central tube. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
